headline: Want $3,100 in Annual Dividends? Invest $18,000 in Each of These 3 Stocks
summary: If you invested $54,000 into stocks averaging that kind of a yield, you'd collect just $756 in annual dividend income.  The best part is that you're not taking on significant risk with these investments, either.  Realty Income (NYSE: O), Pfizer (NYSE: PFE), and Target (NYSE: TGT) are all blue chip stocks that you can hang on for the long haul.

headline: Best Stock to Buy Right Now: Target vs. Realty Income
summary: Target is a large retailer, while Realty Income is a large retail landlord.  Retailers have to keep paying rent if they want access to the stores they lease.  Share prices of Target (NYSE: TGT) have fallen a huge 65% from their 2021 peaks.

headline: Want $1,000 in Annual Dividends? Invest $18,000 in This Tariff-Resistant Dividend Powerhouse
summary: Realty Income is a retail REIT, but it has expanded into new regions and industries.  Realty Income's dividend has a high yield, and it's paid monthly.  After dropping into what looked like it might become a bear market, the S&P 500 has slowly inched up, despite the continued potential threat of the new tariff program.
